abstract: Fabrice P. Tourre, the trader accused of fraud by federal regulators, and at least three officers of the bank are expected to testify before a Senate panel next week in an attempt to defend the firm.
snippet: Fabrice P. Tourre, the trader accused of fraud by federal regulators, and at least three officers of the bank are expected to testify before a Senate panel next week in an attempt to defend the firm.
lead_paragraph: Fabrice P. Tourre, the Goldman Sachs trader accused of fraud by federal regulators, and at least three Goldman officers have agreed to testify before a Senate panel next week in an attempt to defend the firm’s dealings and reputation, Eric Dash of The New York Times reports, citing people briefed on the proceedings.

headline.main: Senate Hot Seat Awaits Goldman Officers and Trader

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
